meanings.definition: Warn (someone) in advance of a danger or problem.
meanings.sent1: I forewarned my friend about the storm approaching.
meanings.sent2: The weatherman forewarned the residents of the hurricane.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel forewarned the other animals about the approaching hawk.
meanings.sent4: The teacher forewarned the students about the difficult test ahead.
meanings.sent5: The wise old owl forewarned the young birds about the dangers of the forest.

meanings.sent1: She felt forewarned about the potential risks of the journey.
meanings.sent2: The forewarned hikers brought extra supplies for the long hike.
meanings.sent3: The forewarned campers were prepared for the sudden rainstorm.
meanings.sent4: The forewarned driver avoided the traffic jam by taking a different route.
meanings.sent5: The forewarned students studied extra hard for the challenging exam.
